entry.title: Off the Beaten Path

Off the Beaten Path

El Cuyo

entry.title: Destination of the Month
entry.content:
Destination of the Month

Kowloon

One of the most densely populated cities on Earth, Hong Kong's mainland portion offers a culture less influenced by the British than the neighboring Island, plus accommodation, dining, and nightlife are generally cheaper.

entry.title: Nobuhiko Jimbo
entry.content: ... that Nobuhiko Jimbo saved future Philippine president Manuel Roxas from execution during World War II, and Roxas did the same for Jimbo four years later?

entry.title: worst drought
entry.content: ... that Turkey is facing its worst drought in the last 50 years?

entry.title: Mariame Clément
entry.content: ... that, when Mariame Clément directed Mozart's Così fan tutte, she froze a wedding tableau during the overture and restarted it in the finale?

entry.title: killing of an official by seven women
entry.content: ... that the killing of an official by seven women was held up as an example of filial piety?

entry.title: Dredge
entry.content: ... that Dredge is a Lovecraftian horror and fishing video game?

entry.title: Birinci İnönü-class submarines
entry.content: ... that the Dutch-built and Turkish-operated Birinci İnönü-class submarines were used to discreetly develop German U-boats?

entry.title: Ilariu Dobridor
entry.content: ... that Romanian far-right journalist Ilariu Dobridor died after being beaten and locked in his own home?

entry.title: The Failure of Technology
entry.content: ... that scholars have described the 1946 book The Failure of Technology as a precursor to the environmental movement?

entry.title: Lorens von der Linde
entry.content: ... that Swedish general Lorens von der Linde (pictured) once shocked a British diplomat with his stories of King Charles X Gustav's German liaisons?
